adjective.description: Characteristic of or befitting a husbandman; characteristic of good husbandry; frugal, thrifty, provident. Now rare.
Characteristic of, befitting, or resembling a husband.

adverb.description: In a manner resembling that of a husband; like a husband. Formerly also: †frugally, thriftily (obsolete). Now rare.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Nicholas Udall (1504–1556), schoolmaster and playwright. From husband + -like.
